question_content.barrons:question: Although she had to ________ that her nephew was rather slow to draw an inference, she did so with reluctance, and pointed out that, to his credit, he did not often jump to conclusions.
question_content.barrons:explanation:
acknowledge; concede.

Read the sentence and try to come up with your own word to fill the blank. Although she had to admit that her nephew was slow, she was reluctant to do so. She did not wish to acknowledge or concede that he was thick as a plank.

Relinquish is incorrect. Relinquish (surrender; release) makes no sense in the context.

Approve is incorrect. Approve makes no sense in the context.

Instigate is incorrect. Instigate (provoke; incite) makes no sense in the context.

Waive is incorrect. Waive (refrain from claiming; put aside) makes no sense in the context.
